response_scale_vas: Slider ranging from „no time at all“ (0; gar keine Zeit) over “half of the time” (5; die Hälfte der Zeit) to “all the time” (10; die ganze Zeit)
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file

development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_instructions: This is about time when you felt you had something to do for yourself, for example reading a book, jogging, working on your own project. We are especially interested in the time you spend alone pursuing your interests. However, other people or your partner may have been present as long as it was in your own interest, i.e. something you do primarily for yourself (e.g. team sports).  (German original: Hier geht es um Zeit, in der Sie das Gefühl hatten etwas für sich zu tun, z.B. ein Buch lesen, joggen, an einem eigenen Projekt arbeiten. Uns interessiert vor allem die Zeit, die Sie alleine Ihren Interessen nachgehen. Es können aber auch andere Personen oder Ihr Partner anwesend gewesen sein, solange es für Sie in Ihrem eigenen Interesse war, also etwas das Sie in erster Linie für sich selbst tun (z.B. Mannschaftssport).)

Die Frage ist, ob Sie die Zeit alleine ohne Interaktion mit anderen verbracht haben (z.B. im Büroraum gearbeitet haben, indem auch ein Kollege sitzt, mit dem Sie sich aber nicht großartig ausgetauscht haben).)

label: Seit [Uhrzeit letzte Befragung oder heute morgen]: Sind eine oder mehrere der folgenden Situationen mit Ihrem Partner aufgetreten?
english: since [time of the last survey or this morning]: have one or more of the following situations occurred with your partner?
comment: some response options changed from the first dataset to the second dataset.we present the response scale from the second dataset.
response_scale_discrete: Participants could check one or more of the following options: "Neutral activity, entertainment or discussion" (Neutrale Aktivität, Unterhaltung oder Diskussion) "Intimate or cordial activity, conversation or discussion (Vertraute oder herzliche Aktivität, Unterhaltung oder Diskussion)" "Weak dispute or tense disagreement (Schwache Streitigkeit oder angespannte Meinungsverschiedenheit / Unstimmigkeit)" "Stronger fight or conflict (Stärkerer Streit oder Konflikt)" "Loving Reconciliation (Liebevolle Versöhnung)" "none of these situations has occurred" (Keine dieser Situationen ist aufgetreten)
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file
citation: Zygar-Hoffmann, C., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2019, October 14). Experience sampling study 2 on motivational dynamics in couples. Retrieved from osf.io/psqx8
how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_use: all beh...partner items can be used in different combinations for own and partner communal and agentic behavior, as well as communal and agentic experiences (see preregistration for assigned weights to the response options: https://osf.io/8vkxr/)
item_instructions: A familiar or cordial activity, entertainment or discussion does not mean routine, irrelevant interactions, such as clarifying responsibilities or communicating the shopping list (= neutral conversation). It is important that the interaction is characterized by warmth and affection. This also includes sharing experiences or physical affection (e.g. cuddling).  For a tense disagreement it is not enough that you and your partner have exchanged different opinions (= neutral discussion), but this exchange must be accompanied by a negative feeling.  (German original: Mit einer vertrauten oder herzlichen Aktivität, Unterhaltung oder Diskussion sind keine routinierten, belanglosen Interaktionen, wie z.B. die Klärung von Verantwortlichkeiten oder die Kommunikation über den Einkaufszettel gemeint (= Neutrale Unterhaltung). Wichtig ist, dass die Interaktion von Wärme und Zuneigung gekennzeichnet ist. Hierunter fällt auch das Teilen von Erfahrungen oder körperliche Zuneigung (z.B. kuscheln).  Für eine angespannte Meinungsverschiedenheit reicht es nicht, dass Sie und Ihr Partner sich über Ihre unterschiedlichen Meinungen ausgetauscht haben (= Neutrale Diskussion), sondern dieser Austausch muss mit einem negativen Gefühl einhergehen.)

label: seit [uhrzeit letzte befragung oder heute morgen]: sind eine oder mehrere der folgenden situationen mit anderen personen aufgetreten?
english: since [time of the last survey or this morning]: have one or more of the following situations occurred with other people?
description: reciprocal behavior with others (beh.b.others  (variant for other persons))
response_scale_discrete: Participants could check one or more of the following options: "Neutral activity, entertainment or discussion" (Neutrale Aktivität, Unterhaltung oder Diskussion) "Intimate or cordial activity, conversation or discussion (Vertraute oder herzliche Aktivität, Unterhaltung oder Diskussion)" "Weak dispute or tense disagreement" (Schwache Streitigkeit oder angespannte Meinungsverschiedenheit / Unstimmigkeit) "Stronger fight or conflict" (Stärkerer Streit oder Konflikt) "Cordial reconciliation" (Herzliche Versöhnung) "none of these situations has occurred" (Keine dieser Situationen ist aufgetreten)
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file
citation: Zygar-Hoffmann, C., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2019, October 14). Experience sampling study 2 on motivational dynamics in couples. Retrieved from osf.io/psqx8
how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_instructions: A familiar or cordial activity, conversation or discussion does not mean routine, irrelevant interactions, such as clarifying responsibilities or communicating about the weather (= neutral conversation). It is important that the interaction is characterized by warmth and affection. This also includes physical affection (e.g. hugging).  For a difference of opinion it is not enough that you and others have exchanged different opinions (= neutral discussion), but this exchange must be accompanied by a negative feeling.  (German original: Mit einer vertrauten oder herzlichen Aktivität, Unterhaltung oder Diskussion sind keine routinierten, belanglosen Interaktionen, wie z.B. die Klärung von Verantwortlichkeiten oder die Kommunikation über das Wetter gemeint (= Neutrale Unterhaltung). Wichtig ist, dass die Interaktion von Wärme und Zuneigung gekennzeichnet ist. Hierunter fällt auch körperliche Zuneigung (z.B. umarmen).  Für eine Meinungsverschiedenheit reicht es nicht, dass Sie und Ihr andere sich über Ihre unterschiedlichen Meinungen ausgetauscht haben (= Neutrale Diskussion), sondern dieser Austausch muss mit einem negativen Gefühl einhergehen.)

label: Von wem ging der stärkere Streit oder Konflikt aus?
english: who initiated the stronger fight or conflict?
response_scale_discrete: "Mainly from you" (Hauptsächlich von Ihnen),  "Mainly from your partner" (Hauptsächlich von Ihrem Partner),  "From both equally" (Von beiden gleichermaßen)
branched_response: a) response = 0 b) response = "stronger fight or conflict" checked
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file
citation: Zygar-Hoffmann, C., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2019, October 14). Experience sampling study 2 on motivational dynamics in couples. Retrieved from osf.io/psqx8
how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_use: all beh...partner items can be used in different combinations for own and partner communal and agentic behavior, as well as communal and agentic experiences (see preregistration for assigned weights to the response options: https://osf.io/8vkxr/)
item_instructions: Please try to indicate who initiated it. If you think of several occassions, please rate who made the first step more often.  (German original: Versuchen Sie bitte anzugeben, von wem die Initiative ausging. Wenn Sie an mehrere Sachen denken, bewerten Sie bitte, wer häufiger den ersten Schritt gemacht hat.)

label: Seit [Uhrzeit letzte Befragung oder heute morgen]: Haben Sie selbst gegenüber Ihrem Partner eine oder mehrere der folgenden Verhaltensweisen gezeigt?
english: Since [time of the last survey or this morning]: have you yourself shown one or more of the following behaviors towards your partner?
comment: some response options changed from the first dataset to the second dataset.we present the response scale from the second dataset.
response_scale_discrete: Participants could check one or more of the following options: "Interest, affection, acceptance, appreciation, understanding or emotional sympathy (Interesse, Zuneigung, Akzeptanz, Wertschätzung, Verständnis oder emotionale Anteilnahme)" "Disinterest, rejection, disapproval, criticism, devaluation or ignorance (Desinteresse, Zurückweisung, Ablehnung, Kritik, Abwertung oder Ignoranz)" "Giving constructive, appreciative feedback / suggestion (Geben von konstruktivem, wertschätzenden Feedback / Anregungen)" "Need or dependency (Hilfebedarf oder Abhängigkeit)" "Praise, admiration or recognition (Lob, Bewunderung oder Anerkennung)" "Necking behavior (Neckendes Verhalten) "no such behavior has occurred (Kein solches Verhalten ist aufgetreten)"
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file
citation: Zygar-Hoffmann, C., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2019, October 14). Experience sampling study 2 on motivational dynamics in couples. Retrieved from osf.io/psqx8
how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_use: all beh...partner items can be used in different combinations for own and partner communal and agentic behavior, as well as communal and agentic experiences (see preregistration for assigned weights to the response options: https://osf.io/8vkxr/)
item_instructions: Please note that some of the categories summarize quite different behaviors. It is sufficient if you have shown one of them to tick the category: For example, if you have shown disinterest towards your partner, this is enough to tick the category 'Disinterest, rejection, rejection, criticism, devaluation or ignorance', even if you have not shown rejection, rejection, criticism, devaluation or ignorance.  (German original: Bitte beachten Sie, dass die Kategorien zum Teil recht unterschiedliches Verhalten zusammenfassen. Es reicht, wenn Sie eines davon gezeigt haben, um die Kategorie anzukreuzen: Wenn Sie z.B. Ihrem Partner gegenüber Desinteresse gezeigt haben, reicht das um die Kategorie 'Desinteresse, Zurückweisung, Ablehnung, Kritik, Abwertung oder Ignoranz' anzukreuzen, auch wenn Sie keine Zurückweisung, Ablehnung, Kritik, Abwertung oder Ignoranz gezeigt haben.)
item_other: For descriptives statistics on instrumental communal behavior and communal experiences, see:  Zygar, C., Hagemeyer, B., Pusch, S., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2018). From motive dispositions to states to outcomes: An intensive experience sampling study on communal motivational dynamics in couples. European Journal of Personality, 32 (3), 306–324.

label: Seit [Uhrzeit letzte Befragung oder heute morgen]: Haben Sie selbst gegenüber Ihrem Partner eine oder mehrere der folgenden Verhaltensweisen gezeigt?
english: Since [time of the last survey or this morning]: Have you yourself shown one or more of the following behaviors towards other people?
description: own behavior in the relationship (beh.a2.partner (extension of beh.a1.partner))
comment: some response options changed from the first dataset to the second dataset.we present the response scale from the second dataset.
response_scale_discrete: Participants could check one or more of the following options: "Put aside own needs / opinion for your partner or took up a subordinate role (Eigene Bedürfnisse/Meinung für Ihren Partner zurückgestellt oder sich untergeordnet)" "Supported your partner unsolicited, surprised or treated him/her (Ihren Partner unaufgefordert unterstützt, überrascht oder ihm/ihr eine Freude bereitet)" "Convinced or influenced your partner or stood up to your partner (Ihren Partner von etwas überzeugt, beeinflusst oder sich gegen Ihren Partner durchgesetzt)" "Did not allow to be influenced of convinced by your partner (Sich von Ihrem Partner nicht beeinflussen oder nicht überzeugen lassen)" "Elicited strong positive or negative feelings in your partner (Starke positive oder negative Gefühle bei Ihrem Partner ausgelöst)" "Let your partner decide something (Ihren Partner etwas entscheiden lassen)" "Got to know what your partner is doing/thinking at the moment (In Erfahrung gebracht, was Ihr Partner gerade macht/denkt)" "Gave a lot of attention or regard to your partner (Ihrem Partner besonders viel Beachtung oder Aufmerksamkeit geschenkt)" "Payed notably few attention or gave notably few regard to your partner (Ihrem Partner besonders wenig Beachtung oder Aufmerksamkeit geschenkt) " "no such behavior has occurred (Kein solches Verhalten ist aufgetreten)"
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file
citation: Zygar-Hoffmann, C., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2019, October 14). Experience sampling study 2 on motivational dynamics in couples. Retrieved from osf.io/psqx8
how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_use: all beh...partner items can be used in different combinations for own and partner communal and agentic behavior, as well as communal and agentic experiences (see preregistration for assigned weights to the response options: https://osf.io/8vkxr/)
item_instructions: Please note that some of the categories summarize quite different behaviors. It is sufficient if you have shown one of them to tick the category: If, for example, you have supported your partner unsolicitedly, this is enough to tick the category 'support your partner unsolicitedly, surprise him/her or give him/her pleasure', even if you have not surprised your partner.  (German original: Bitte beachten Sie, dass die Kategorien zum Teil recht unterschiedliches Verhalten zusammenfassen. Es reicht, wenn Sie eines davon gezeigt haben, um die Kategorie anzukreuzen: Wenn Sie z.B. Ihren Partner unaufgefordert unterstützt haben, reicht das um die Kategorie 'Ihren Partner unaufgefordert unterstützt, überrascht oder ihm/ihr eine Freude bereitet' anzukreuzen, auch wenn Sie Ihren Partner nicht überrascht haben.)
item_other: For descriptives statistics on instrumental communal behavior and communal experiences, see:  Zygar, C., Hagemeyer, B., Pusch, S., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2018). From motive dispositions to states to outcomes: An intensive experience sampling study on communal motivational dynamics in couples. European Journal of Personality, 32 (3), 306–324.

english: since [time of the last survey or this morning]: have you yourself shown one or more of the following behaviors towards other people?
description: own behavior towards others (beh.a2.others (extension of beh.a1.others))
response_scale_discrete: Participants could check one or more of the following options: "Put aside own needs / opinion for other persons or took up a subordinate role (Eigene Bedürfnisse/Meinung für andere Personen zurückgestellt oder sich untergeordnet)" "Supported others unsolicited, surprised or treated others (Andere unaufgefordert unterstützt, überrascht oder anderen eine Freude bereitet)" "Convinced or influenced others or stood up to other persons (Andere von etwas überzeugt, beeinflusst oder sich gegen andere Personen durchgesetzt)" "Did not allow to be influenced of convinced by others (Sich von Anderen nicht beeinflussen oder nicht überzeugen lassen)" "Elicited strong positive or negative feelings in others (Starke positive oder negative Gefühle bei anderen ausgelöst)" "Let others decide something (Andere etwas entscheiden lassen)" "Got to know what others are doing/thinking at the moment (In Erfahrung gebracht, was andere gerade machen/denken)" "Gave a lot of attention or regard to others (Anderen besonders viel Beachtung oder Aufmerksamkeit geschenkt)" "Payed notably few attention or gave notably few regard to others (Anderen besonders wenig Beachtung oder Aufmerksamkeit geschenkt)" "no such behavior has occurred (Kein solches Verhalten ist aufgetreten)"
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file
citation: Zygar-Hoffmann, C., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2019, October 14). Experience sampling study 2 on motivational dynamics in couples. Retrieved from osf.io/psqx8
how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_instructions: lease note that some of the categories summarize quite different behaviors. It is sufficient if you have shown one of them to tick the category: For example, if you have supported others unsolicitedly, this is enough to tick the category 'support others unsolicitedly, surprise them or give them pleasure', even if you have not surprised others.  (German original: Bitte beachten Sie, dass die Kategorien zum Teil recht unterschiedliches Verhalten zusammenfassen. Es reicht, wenn Sie eines davon gezeigt haben, um die Kategorie anzukreuzen: Wenn Sie z.B. andere unaufgefordert unterstützt haben, reicht das um die Kategorie 'andere unaufgefordert unterstützt, überrascht oder ihm/ihr eine Freude bereitet' anzukreuzen, auch wenn Sie andere nicht überrascht haben.)
item_other: For descriptives statistics on instrumental communal behavior and communal experiences, see:  Zygar, C., Hagemeyer, B., Pusch, S., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2018). From motive dispositions to states to outcomes: An intensive experience sampling study on communal motivational dynamics in couples. European Journal of Personality, 32 (3), 306–324.

label: Seit [Uhrzeit letzte Befragung oder heute morgen]: Haben Sie selbst eine oder mehrere der folgenden Verhaltensweisen gezeigt? Auch wenn Sie die Zeit seit der letzten Befragung alleine verbracht haben, könnten Sie z.B. eine nette Email geschrieben, einen Anruf ignoriert, eine Hotline kontaktiert haben.
english: since [time of the last survey or this morning]: have you shown one or more of the following behaviors? even if you have spent time alone since the last survey, you may have written a nice email, ignored a call, or contacted a hotline.
description: own behavior when alone (beh.a1.alone (variant for being alone))
response_scale_discrete: Participants could check one or more of the following options: "Interest, affection, acceptance, appreciation, understanding or emotional sympathy (Interesse, Zuneigung, Akzeptanz, Wertschätzung, Verständnis oder emotionale Anteilnahme)" "Disinterest, rejection, disapproval, criticism, devaluation or ignorance (Desinteresse, Zurückweisung, Ablehnung, Kritik, Abwertung oder Ignoranz)" "Giving constructive, appreciative feedback / suggestion (Geben von konstruktivem, wertschätzenden Feedback / Anregungen)" "Need or dependency (Hilfebedarf oder Abhängigkeit)" "Praise, admiration or recognition (Lob, Bewunderung oder Anerkennung)" "Necking behavior (Neckendes Verhalten) "no such behavior has occurred (Kein solches Verhalten ist aufgetreten)"
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file
citation: Zygar-Hoffmann, C., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2019, October 14). Experience sampling study 2 on motivational dynamics in couples. Retrieved from osf.io/psqx8
how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_instructions: Please note that some of the categories summarize quite different behaviors. It is sufficient if you have shown one of them to tick the category: For example, if you have shown disinterest, this is enough to check the category 'Disinterest, rejection, rejection, criticism, devaluation or ignorance', even if you have not shown rejection, rejection, criticism, devaluation or ignorance.  (German original: Bitte beachten Sie, dass die Kategorien zum Teil recht unterschiedliches Verhalten zusammenfassen. Es reicht, wenn Sie eines davon gezeigt haben, um die Kategorie anzukreuzen: Wenn Sie z.B. Desinteresse gezeigt haben, reicht das um die Kategorie 'Desinteresse, Zurückweisung, Ablehnung, Kritik, Abwertung oder Ignoranz' anzukreuzen, auch wenn Sie keine Zurückweisung, Ablehnung, Kritik, Abwertung oder Ignoranz gezeigt haben.)
item_other: For descriptives statistics on instrumental communal behavior and communal experiences, see:  Zygar, C., Hagemeyer, B., Pusch, S., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2018). From motive dispositions to states to outcomes: An intensive experience sampling study on communal motivational dynamics in couples. European Journal of Personality, 32 (3), 306–324.

label: seit [uhrzeit letzte befragung oder heute morgen]: haben sie selbst eine oder mehrere der folgenden verhaltensweisen gezeigt?
english: since [time of the last survey or this morning]: have you shown one or more of the following behaviors?
description: own behavior when alone (beh.a2.alone (extension of beh.a1.alone))
response_scale_discrete: Participants could check one or more of the following options: "Put aside own needs / opinion or took up a subordinate role (Eigene Bedürfnisse/Meinung zurückgestellt oder sich untergeordnet)" "Supported someone unsolicited, surprised or treated someone (Jemanden unaufgefordert unterstützt, überrascht oder anderen eine Freude bereitet)" "Convinced or influenced someone or stood up to someone (Jemanden von etwas überzeugt, beeinflusst oder sich gegen jemanden durchgesetzt)" "Did not allow to be influenced of convinced by someone (Sich von jemandem nicht beeinflussen oder nicht überzeugen lassen)" "Elicited strong positive or negative feelings in someone (Starke positive oder negative Gefühle bei jemandem ausgelöst)" "Let someone decide something (Jemanden etwas entscheiden lassen)" "Got to know what someone is doing/thinking at the moment (In Erfahrung gebracht, was jemand gerade macht/denkt)" "Gave a lot of attention or regard to someone (Jemandem besonders viel Beachtung oder Aufmerksamkeit geschenkt)" "Payed notably few attention or gave notably few regard to someone (Jemandem besonders wenig Beachtung oder Aufmerksamkeit geschenkt)" "no such behavior has occurred (Kein solches Verhalten ist aufgetreten)"

how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_instructions: Please note that some of the categories summarize quite different behaviors. It is sufficient if you have shown one of them to tick the category: For example, if you have provided unsolicited support, this is enough to tick the category 'Support someone unsolicited, surprise someone, or please someone', even if you have not surprised anyone.  (German original: Bitte beachten Sie, dass die Kategorien zum Teil recht unterschiedliches Verhalten zusammenfassen. Es reicht, wenn Sie eines davon gezeigt haben, um die Kategorie anzukreuzen: Wenn Sie z.B. unaufgefordert Unterstützung geleistet haben, reicht das um die Kategorie 'Jemanden unaufgefordert unterstützt, überrascht oder ihm/ihr eine Freude bereitet' anzukreuzen, auch wenn Sie niemanden überrascht haben.)
item_other: For descriptives statistics on instrumental communal behavior and communal experiences, see:  Zygar, C., Hagemeyer, B., Pusch, S., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2018). From motive dispositions to states to outcomes: An intensive experience sampling study on communal motivational dynamics in couples. European Journal of Personality, 32 (3), 306–324.

label: Seit der letzten Befragung: Hat Ihr Partner eine oder mehrere der folgenden Verhaltensweisen Ihnen gegenüber gezeigt?
english: since the last survey: has your partner showed one or more of the following behaviors towards you?
comment: some response options changed from the first dataset to the second dataset. we present the response scale from the second dataset.
response_scale_discrete: Participants could check one or more of the following options: "Interest, affection, acceptance, appreciation, understanding or emotional sympathy (Interesse, Zuneigung, Akzeptanz, Wertschätzung, Verständnis oder emotionale Anteilnahme)" "Disinterest, rejection, disapproval, criticism, devaluation or ignorance (Desinteresse, Zurückweisung, Ablehnung, Kritik, Abwertung oder Ignoranz)" "Giving constructive, appreciative feedback / suggestion (Geben von konstruktivem, wertschätzenden Feedback / Anregungen)" "Need or dependency (Hilfebedarf oder Abhängigkeit)" "Praise, admiration or recognition (Lob, Bewunderung oder Anerkennung)" "Necking behavior (Neckendes Verhalten) "no such behavior has occurred (Kein solches Verhalten ist aufgetreten)"
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file
citation: Zygar-Hoffmann, C., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2019, October 14). Experience sampling study 2 on motivational dynamics in couples. Retrieved from osf.io/psqx8
how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_use: all beh...partner items can be used in different combinations for own and partner communal and agentic behavior, as well as communal and agentic experiences (see preregistration for assigned weights to the response options: https://osf.io/8vkxr/)
item_instructions: Please note that some of the categories summarize quite different behaviors. It is enough for your partner to have shown one of them to tick the category: For example, if your partner has shown interest, this is enough to tick the category 'Interest, affection, acceptance, appreciation, understanding or emotional involvement', even if your partner has not shown acceptance, affection, appreciation, understanding or emotional involvement.  (German original: Bitte beachten Sie, dass die Kategorien zum Teil recht unterschiedliches Verhalten zusammenfassen. Es reicht, dass Ihr Partner eines davon gezeigt hat, um die Kategorie anzukreuzen: Wenn Ihr Partner z.B. Interesse gezeigt hat, reicht das, um die Kategorie 'Interesse, Zuneigung, Akzeptanz, Wertschätzung, Verständnis oder emotionale Anteilnahme' anzukreuzen, auch wenn Ihr Partner nicht Akzeptanz, Zuneigung, Wertschätzung, Verständnis oder emotionale Anteilnahme gezeigt hat.)
item_other: For descriptives statistics on instrumental communal behavior and communal experiences, see:  Zygar, C., Hagemeyer, B., Pusch, S., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2018). From motive dispositions to states to outcomes: An intensive experience sampling study on communal motivational dynamics in couples. European Journal of Personality, 32 (3), 306–324.

label: Seit der letzten Befragung: Hat Ihr Partner eine oder mehrere der folgenden Verhaltensweisen Ihnen gegenüber gezeigt?

description: partner behavior in the relationship (beh.p2.partner (extension of beh.p1.partner))
comment: some response options changed from the first dataset to the second dataset. we present the response scale from the second dataset.
response_scale_discrete: Participants could check one or more of the following options: "Put aside his/her needs / opinion for you or took up a subordinate role (Eigene Bedürfnisse/Meinung für Sie zurückgestellt oder sich untergeordnet)" "Supported you unsolicited, surprised or treated you (Sie unaufgefordert unterstützt, überrascht oder Ihnen eine Freude bereitet)" "Convinced or influenced you, stood up to you (Sie von etwas überzeugt, beeinflusst, oder sich gegen Sie durchgesetzt)" "Did not allow to be influenced of convinced by you (Sich nicht von Ihnen beeinflussen oder überzeugen lassen)" "Elicited strong positive or negative feelings in you (Starke positive oder negative Gefühle bei Ihnen ausgelöst)" "Let you decide something (Sie etwas entscheiden lassen)" "Got to know what you are doing/thinking at the moment (In Erfahrung gebracht, was Sie gerade machen/denken)" "Payed a lot of attention or gave a lot of regard to you (Ihnen besonders viel Beachtung oder Aufmerksamkeit geschenkt)" "Payed notably few attention or gave notably few of regard to you (Ihnen besonders wenig Beachtung oder Aufmerksamkeit geschenkt)" "no such behavior has occurred (Kein solches Verhalten ist aufgetreten)"

item_instructions: Please note that some of the categories summarize quite different behaviors. item_other: For descriptives statistics on instrumental communal behavior and communal experiences, see:  Zygar, C., Hagemeyer, B., Pusch, S., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2018). From motive dispositions to states to outcomes: An intensive experience sampling study on communal motivational dynamics in couples. European Journal of Personality, 32 (3), 306–324.

Es reicht, wenn jemand eines davon gezeigt hat, um die Kategorie anzukreuzen: Wenn jemand Sie z.B. von etwas überzeugt hat, reicht das, um die Kategorie 'Sie beeinflusst, von etwas überzeugt oder sich gegen Sie durchgesetzt' anzukreuzen, auch wenn niemand Sie beeinflusst oder sich gegen Sie durchgesetzt haben.)

label: Seit [Uhrzeit letzte Befragung oder heute morgen]: Wie war Ihr eigenes Verhalten in Bezug auf Ihren Partner? 1. Je dominanter, desto weiter oben tippen. 2. Je herzlicher, desto weiter rechts tippen.
english: since [time of the last survey or this morning]: how was your own behavior towards your partner? 1. your answer should be higher the more dominant it was. 2. your answer should be farther on the right, the friendlier it was.since [time of the last survey or this morning]:
description: own friendly and dominant behavior towards the partner (ipc.a.partner)
comment: the presentation of the ipc grid changed slightly from the first to the second dataset. we present the grid used in the second dataset.
response_scale_vas: presentation of an interperstonal circumplex grid (see https://osf.io/udxr5/): friendly behavior is measured by the position of the answer on the x-axis, dominant behavior by the position of the answer on the y-axis.
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file
citation: Zygar-Hoffmann, C., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2019, October 14). Experience sampling study 2 on motivational dynamics in couples. Retrieved from osf.io/psqx8
existing_ref: wiggins, j. s. (1979). a psychological taxonomy of trait-descriptive terms: the interpersonal domain. journal of personality and social psychology
how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_instructions: On the picture, please indicate the point that best matches your assessment of your overall behavior since the last survey.  The more dominant you were, the higher up you should tap on, and the more cordial youwere, the further to the right you should tap on.  If your behaviour was neutral or if you did not behave towards your partner in any way, i.e. you were neither dominant, reserved, warm or hostile in one direction, then please tap on the middle.  If you have been both dominant and restrained, or have been both warm and hostile, please tap on the part of the image that goes in the direction of the behaviour that was stronger.  (German original: Bitte tippen Sie auf dem Bild den Punkt an, der Ihrer Einschätzung Ihres gesamten eigenen Verhaltens seit der letzten Befragung am Besten entspricht.  Je dominanter Sie sich verhalten haben, desto weiter oben sollten Sie tippen, und je herzlicher, desto weiter rechts sollten Sie tippen.  Wenn Ihr Verhalten neutral war oder wenn Sie sich gegenüber Ihrem Partner nicht in irgendeiner Art und Weise verhalten haben, also Sie weder in eine Richtung dominant, zurückhaltend, herzlich oder ablehnend waren, dann tippen Sie bitte in die Mitte.  Sollten Sie sich sowohl dominant als auch zurückhaltend, oder sowohl herzlich als auch ablehnend verhalten haben, tippen Sie bitte die Stelle an, die in die Richtung des Verhaltens geht, das stärker war.)

item_instructions: On the picture, please indicate the point that best matches your assessment of the overall behavior of your partner since the last survey.  The more dominant your partner has been, the higher up you should tap on, and the more cordial, the further to the right. If your partner's behaviour was neutral or if your partner did not behave towards you in any way, i.e. was neither dominant, reserved, warm nor hostile in one direction, then please tap on the middle.   If your partner has been both dominant and restrained, or has been both warm and hostile, please tap on the part of the image that goes in the direction of the behaviour that was stronger. Wenn das Verhalten Ihres Partners neutral war oder wenn Ihr Partner sich gegenüber Ihnen nicht in irgendeiner Art und Weise verhalten hat, also weder in eine Richtung dominant, zurückhaltend, herzlich oder ablehnend war, dann tippen Sie bitte in die Mitte.   Sollte Ihr Partner sich sowohl dominant als auch zurückhaltend, oder sowohl herzlich als auch ablehnend verhalten haben, tippen Sie bitte die Stelle an, die in die Richtung des Verhaltens geht, das stärker war.)

label: Wie glücklich sind Sie mit Ihrem eigenen Verhalten seit [Uhrzeit letzte Befragung oder heute morgen] Ihrem Partner gegenüber?

response_scale_vas: Slider ranging from „very unhappy“ (0; sehr unglücklich) over "neutral" (5; neutral) to “very happy” (10; sehr glücklich)

label: Seit der letzten Befragung / dem Aufstehen heute morgen: Haben Sie eher Zuneigung oder eher Ablehnung von anderen Personen erfahren?
english: since the last survey / this morning: have you rather experienced affection or rejection from others?
comment: wording changed slightly and the response scale changed from 1-7 in the first dataset to 0-10 in the second dataset. we present the wording and response scale from the second dataset.
response_scale_discrete: 1-7 ("a lot of rejection" (viel ablehnung) - "neither" (weder noch) - "a lot of affection" (viel zuneigung))
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file
citation: Zygar-Hoffmann, Caroline, and Felix D Schönbrodt. “Experience Sampling Study 1 on Motivational Dynamics in Couples.” OSF, 16 July 2019. Web.
how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_instructions: if you have received as much affection as rejection, please tap on 'neither or both the same'.  (german original: wenn sie gleichviel zuneigung wie ablehnung erhalten haben, tippen sie bitte auf 'weder noch oder beides gleichviel'..)

label: Seit [Uhrzeit letzte Befragung oder heute morgen]: Hatten Sie eher Einfluss auf andere Personen oder haben Sie eher Hilflosigkeit gefühlt? z.B. andere von etwas überzeugt (oder eben nicht), andere aufgemuntert (oder eben nicht) oder sich gegen andere durchgesetzt (oder eben nicht).
english: since [time of last survey or this morning]: have you had more influence on other people or have you felt more helplessness? e.g. convinced others of something (or not), cheered others up (or not) or prevailed against others (or not).
comment: the response scale changed from 1-7 in the first dataset to 0-10 in the second dataset.
response_scale_vas: Slider ranging from „a lot of helplessness“ (0; viel Hilflosigkeit) over „neither or both equallyl“ (5; weder noch oder beides gleichermaßen) to “a lot of  influence” (10; sehr viel Einfluss)
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file
citation: Zygar-Hoffmann, C., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2019, October 14). Experience sampling study 2 on motivational dynamics in couples. Retrieved from osf.io/psqx8
how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_instructions: if you have asserted yourself just as much as other people, please tap on 'neither or both the same'.  (german original: wenn sie sich genauso viel wie andere personen durchgesetzt haben, tippen sie bitte auf 'weder noch oder beides gleichviel'.)

label: seit der letzten befragung / dem aufstehen heute morgen: haben sich eher sie oder eher andere personen bei diskussionen, unterhaltungen, entscheidungen an denen sie beteiligt waren durchgesetzt?
english: since time of the last survey or this morning: were you or other people more likely to assert themselves in discussions, conversations, decisions in which you were involved?
response_scale_discrete: 1-7 ("others have asserted themselves" (andere haben sich durchgesetzt) - neither (weder noch) - "you have asserted yourself" (sie haben sich durchgesetzt))
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file
citation: Zygar-Hoffmann, C., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2019, October 14). Experience sampling study 2 on motivational dynamics in couples. Retrieved from osf.io/psqx8
how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_instructions: the last survey was in the last 1-5 hours. if you missed the last survey, please remember the last 5 hours.  if you have not been in contact with anyone or you have asserted yourself as much as other people, please tap 'neither'.  (german original: die letzte befragung war irgendwann in den letzten 1-5h. wenn sie die letzte befragung verpasst haben, denken sie bitte an die letzten 5 stunden.  wenn sie mit niemandem kontakt hatten oder sie sich gleichviel wie andere personen durchgesetzt haben, tippen sie bitte auf 'weder noch'.)

label: Wie selbstständig in der Beziehung fühlen Sie sich jetzt gerade?
english: how independent in the relationship do you feel right now?
description: momentary experience of independence in the relationship (status.a1)
comment: the response scale changed from 1-7 in the first dataset to 0-10 in the second dataset.
response_scale_vas: Slider ranging from „not at all“ (0; überhaupt nicht) over „neutral“ (5; neutral) to “very strongly” (10; sehr stark)
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de
request: dataset 1:  scientific use-file: https://www.psychdata.de/index.php?main=search&sub=browse&id=zrce16dy99&lang=ger&version=20000  dataset 2: currently in preparation as a scientific use-file
citation: Zygar-Hoffmann, C., & Schönbrodt, F. D. (2019, October 14). Experience sampling study 2 on motivational dynamics in couples. Retrieved from osf.io/psqx8
how_long_beep: 45 minutes (exception: in dataset 2 the evening survey had a timeout of 300 minutes)
development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_instructions: Here you are not asked how independent you generally feel in the relationship, but how independent you feel in your relationship right now.  By a feeling of independence we mean that you feel autonomous and able to make decisions independently of your partner.  (German original: Hier ist nicht danach gefragt wie selbstständig Sie sich generell in der Beziehung fühlen, sondern wie selbeständig Sie sich jetzt gerade im Moment in Ihrer Beziehung fühlen.  Unter einem Gefühl von Selbstständigkeit verstehen wir, dass Sie sich autonom und unabhängig von Ihrem Partner fähig fühlen Entscheidungen zu treffen.)

label: Wie einflussreich in der Beziehung fühlen Sie sich jetzt gerade?
english: how influential in the relationship do you feel right now?
description: momentary experience of influence in the relationship (status.a2)
comment: the response scale changed from 1-7 in the first dataset to 0-10 in the second dataset.
response_scale_vas: Slider ranging from „very helpless“ (0; total hilflos) over „neutral“ (5; neutral) to “very influential” (10; sehr einflussreich)
contact: caroline zygar-hoffmann, caroline.zygar@psy.lmu.de; felix schönbrodt, felix.schoenbrodt@psy.lmu.de

development: we piloted most items, checked descriptives and variances, and received feedback from participants on their understanding of the items and response scales.
item_instructions: This is not about how influential you generally feel in the relationship, but how influential you feel in your relationship right now.  (German original: Hier ist nicht danach gefragt wie einflussreich Sie sich generell in der Beziehung fühlen, sondern wie einflussreich Sie sich jetzt gerade im Moment in Ihrer Beziehung fühlen.)

label: Wie emotional nahe fühlen Sie sich Ihrem Partner jetzt gerade?    Wie es gerade tatsächlich ist:
english: how emotionally close do you feel to your partner right now?   how it is actually right now:
description: momentary experience of emotional closeness in the relationship (status.ios)
response_scale_vas: Slider ranging from „distance“ (1; Abstand) to “maximal closeness” (7; maximale Nähe) with overlapping circles (ios, see https://osf.io/pvfw7/)

response_scale_discrete: Participants could chose one of the following: -At Work (In der Arbeit) -At the place of education (Am Ausbildungsort) -At home (Zu Hause) -At the house of friends / family / partner (Bei Freunden / Familie / Partner zu Hause) -At a shop (In einem Geschäft) -At a restaurant, café, bar, club (In einem Restaurant, Café, Bar, Club) -At the cinema, fitness studio (Im Kino, Fitnessstudio) -Commuting (Unterwegs) -Other location (anderer Ort)

(german original: hier geht es um ihre umgebung. wenn sie sich also im home-office befinden, ist dies 'zu hause' und nicht 'in der arbeit'.  wenn sie mit ihrem partner zusammenwohnen und gerade zu hause sind, tippen sie bitte 'zu hause' an.)

item_other: Follow up-info if the answer to this question is "yes": "We understand that it is tempting to look at what the partner is ticking or to tell the partner your answers. In order to avoid distortions, we ask you not to communicate with your partner in future surveys. Many thanks! branched_from: ik ben virtueel in contact met anderen (im interacting with others online)
branched_response: any or several of the following options were selected: ja, en ik ben aan het lezen/scrollen/liken (yes, and i am reading/scrolling/liking) -  ja, en ik ben aan het posten (yes, and i am posting) - ja, en ik ben aan het chatten (yes, and i am chatting) - ja, en ik ben met anderen iets aan het doen (bv gamen) (yes, and i am doing something together with others (for example, gaming))
citation: Kirtley, O. J., Achterhof, R., Hagemann, N., Hermans, K. S. F. M., Hiekkaranta, A. P., Lecei, A., … Myin-Germeys, I. (2021, April 2). how_admin: phone (study phone given by researchers for the esm period, not participant's own phone), using mobileq app

label: 23. Heeft u sinds de vorige meting geslapen?
english: Have you slept since the previous assessment?
description: The questions are about things since the previous survey. If respondents answered 'yes' follow-up question 23a & 23b. If respondent answered 'no' follow-up question 24.

label: 23a. Heeft u goed geslapen?
english: Did you sleep well?

label: 23b. Hoeveel tijd heeft u geslapen?
english: How long did you sleep?

label: 24. Heeft u sinds de vorige meting iets alledaags (on)plezierigs meegemaakt?
english: Did you have daily (un)pleasant experiences since you filled out the previous assessement?
description: If respondent answered yes, something pleasant follow-up question 24a t/m 24c. If respondent answered yes, something unpleasant follow-up question 24d t/m 24f. If respondent answered yes, both something pleasant and unpleasant follow-up question 24a t/m f. If respondent answered none follow-up question 25.
response_scale_discrete: 1-4 ((1) yes, something pleasant, (2) yes, something unpleasant, (3) yes, both something pleasant and unpleasant, (4) none )

label: 24a. Denk aan de meest plezierige ervaring: Hoe plezierig was deze ervaring?
english: Think about the most  pleasant experience: How pleasant was this experience?

label: 24b. Hoe belangrijk was deze plezierige ervaring?
english: How important was this pleasant experience?

label: 24c. De plezierige ervaring had te maken met
english: The pleasant experience involved
response_scale_discrete: 1-8 ((1) Myself, (2) Partner, (3) Home situation, (4) Work/school, (5) Family/friends/acquaintances, (6) Stangers, (7) Society, (8) Something else)

label: 24d. Denk aan de meest onplezierige ervaring: Hoe onplezierig was deze ervaring?
english: Think about the most unpleasant experience: How unpleasant was this experience?

label: 24e. Hoe belangrijk was deze onplezierige ervaring?
english: How important was this unpleasant experience?

label: 24f. De onplezierige ervaring had te maken met
english: The unpleasant experience involved
response_scale_discrete: 1-8 ((1) Myself, (2) Partner, (3) Home situation, (4) Work/school, (5) Family/friends/acquaintances, (6) Stangers, (7) Society, (8) Something else)

label: 25. Wat heeft u sinds de vorige meting gedaan?
english: Which activities have you been involved in since the last assessment?
response_scale_discrete: 1-9 ((1) Resting/sleeping , (2) Household activities, (3) Working/studying, (4) Watching TV, (5) Internet/gaming/social media, (6) Other leisure activities, (7) Talking, (8) Being on my way somewhere, (9) Something else)

label: 26. Hoeveel sigaretten heeft u gerookt sinds de laatste meting?
english: How  many cigarettes have you smoked since last assessment?
description: Pull-down menu; This items was only included when the participant indicated that he/she was a current smoker during intake.

label: 27. Hoeveel koppen koffie heeft u gedronken sinds de laatste meting?
english: How many cups of coffee have you drunk since last assessment?

label: 28. Hoeveel glazen alcohol heeft u gedronken sinds de laatste meting?
english: How many glasses of alcohol have you drunk since last assessment?

label: 29. Heeft u vandaag meer of minder gegeten dan u doorgaans zou doen?
english: Have you eaten more or less than usual today?
description: Follow-up question 29 only asked if it is the last questionnaire of the day.
comment: This item was assessed for 2 weeks but only filled-out at the last assessment of the day (i.e. once a day)

label: 30. Hoe storend vindt u het om nu de vragenlijst in te vullen?
english: How disturbing is filling out a questionnaire right now?

label: 31. Als u wilt kunt u hieronder nog opmerkingen over deze meting kwijt
english: If you want you can write below comments about this assessment
response_scale_discrete: noNE; String; Open field. no limit on the number of character

label: 1. Hebben zich veranderingen voorgedaan in uw medicatiegebruik gedurende de afgelopen twee weken van dit dagboekonderzoek?
english: Have there been changes in your medication use during the last two weeks of this diary research?
description: If respondent answered no follow-up question 2. If respondent answered yes follow-up question 1a.

label: 1a. Welke veranderingen in uw medicatiegebruik?
english: What had changed in your use of medication?
response_scale_discrete: noNE; String; Open field. no limit on the number of character

label: 2. Bent u een vrouw?
english: Are you a woman?
description: If respondent answered no follow-up question 3. If respondent answered yes follow-up question 2a.

label: 2a. Menstrueert u nog?
english: Are you still menstruating?
description: If respondent answered no follow-up question 3. If respondent answered yes follow-up question 2b & 2c &2d.

label: 2b. Wat was de eerste dag van uw laatste menstruatie?
english: What was the first day of your last period?

label: 2c. Heeft u een regelmatige cyclus?
english: Do you have a regular menstrual cycle?

label: 2d. Hoeveel dagen duurt uw cyclus?
english: What is the duration of your cycle in days?

label: 3. Hoe belastend vond u het dagboekonderzoek over het geheel genomen?
english: How burdensome did you find the diary survey overall?
description: The following questions are about your experience with the diary assessments.

label: 4. Hoe belastend vond u de lengte van het onderzoek (14 dagen)?
english: How burdensome did you find the duration of the study (14 days)?

label: 5. Hoe belastend vond u de meetfrequentie (5 x per dag)?
english: How burdensome did you find the assessment frequency (5 times a day)?

label: 6. Hoe belastend vond u het aantal vragen per meting?
english: How burdensome did you find the number of questions per assessment?

label: 7. Zou u nog een keer meedoen aan een onderzoek waarin er gebruik wordt gemaakt van dagboekmetingen?
english: Would you participate again in a study using diary assessments?

label: 8. De meeste mensen missen tijdens het onderzoek weleens een meting. Wat was/waren voor u de belangrijkste reden(en)?
english: Most people missed  a few assessments during the diary research. What was/were the main reasons for you? (multiple answers possible)
description: Multiple answers possible If respondent answers Something else, namelijk: open field: no litmit on the number of characters.
response_scale_discrete: "1-9 ((1) Does not apply, I have not missed a single assessment, (2) I did not have the Smartphone with me, (3) There were technical problems, (4) There was no network connection, (5) I was sleeping, (6) I could not make myself do it, (7) I was busy with an activity, (8) I did not hear the Smartphone, (9) Something else, namely:)"

label: 9a. Hoe vond u het over het algemeen om de vragen in het dagboekje te beantwoorden?
english: Rate your overall experience of filling out the questions in the diary.

label: 9b.
english: Rate your overall experience of filling out the questions in the diary.

label: 10. Waren er specifieke vragen in de dagboekjes die u moeilijk of vervelend vond om te beantwoorden?
english: Were there specific questions in the diary which you found difficult  or annoying to answer?
description: If respondent answered no follow-up question 11. If respondent answered yes follow-up question 10a.

label: 10a. Zo ja, wilt u hieronder kort aangeven wat u moeilijk of vervelend vond?
english: If so, please describe below what you found difficult or annoying?

label: 11. In hoeverre heeft u uw dagelijks ritme aangepast aan de metingen?
english: To what extent did you adjust your daily rhythm to the assessments?

label: 12. Werden uw emoties weleens negatief be?nvloed door het beantwoorden van de vragen?
english: Were your emotions sometimes negatively influenced by answering the questions ?

label: 13. Werden uw emoties weleens positief be?nvloed door het beantwoorden van de vragen?
english: Were your emotions sometimes positively influenced by answering the questions?

label: 14. Wat vond u van de eerste mondelinge dagboekinstructie door de onderzoeksmedewerker?
english: What do you think of the initial  instruction given by the research assistant?

label: 15. Wat vond u van de geschreven instructies die u mee naar huis heeft gekregen?
english: What do you think of the the written instructions to take home?

label: 16. Wat vond u van de telefonische ondersteunding door de onderzoeksmedewerkers?
english: What do you think of the the telephonic support by the research assistant?

label: 17. Heeft u verder nog opmerkingen over uw deelname aan het dagboekonderzoek?
english: Do you have any comments about your participation in the diary research?
response_scale_discrete: noNE; String; Open field. no limit on the number of character

branched_from: Wie heb je voor het laatst gezien n gesproken in het afgelopen uur?
branched_response: Answer not "Ik heb mijn (stief)ouders niet gezien en gesproken."
contact: Anne B?low (bulow@essb.eur.nl, PhD Student) & Loes Keijsers (keijsers@essb.eur.nl, PI)
citation: B?low, A., van Roekel, E., Boele, S., Denissen, J. J. A., & Keijsers, L. (2022). Parent-adolescent interaction quality and adolescent affect - an experience sampling study on effect heterogeneity. Child Development, 00, 1?17. https://doi.org/10.1111/cdev.13733
existing_adapt: see description in paper (B?low et al, 2022)
validity: see description in paper (B?low et al, 2022)
development: The item has been used with 4 other items to measure parental warmth (B?low et al, 2022)

label: I feel down
other: 6 semi-random beeps a day (at least one hour between each beep)
which: Psychosis (ICD.10 F20-29) excluding postpartum, drug induced and organic
citation: Radley, J., Barlow, J. & Johns, L. C . (2022).  Parenting and psychosis: An experience sampling methodology study investigating the inter-relationship between stress from parenting and positive psychotic symptoms. British Journal of Clinical Psychology, 1-23. https://doi.org/10.1111/bjc.12389
existing_adapt: This negative affect questions were taken from previous ESM work
existing_ref: Myin-Germeys, I., van Os, J., Schwartz, J. E., Stone, A. A., & Delespaul, P. A. (2001). Emotional reactivity to daily life stress in psychosis. Archives of general psychiatry, 58(12), 1137-1144.
how_admin: mobileQ software downloaded onto nokia 2.1 phones
how_long_beep: Researcher doesn't know how long: the software that was used, mobileQ, determined how long the participants could answer the survey for after it appeared.
item_use: This item is used with the other 'negative affect' items as an index of negative affect
item_instructions: n.a.
item_other: positive skew

label: Tokom dana?njeg dana?
english: Today, I?
contact: Danka Puri?, dpuric@f.bg.ac.rs; Ljiljana Lazarevic, ljiljana.lazarevic@f.bg.ac.rs
citation: Puri?, D., Petrovi?, M. B., ?ivanovic, M., Luki?, P., Zupan, Z., Brankovi?, M., Ninkovi?, M., Lazarevi?, L. B., Stankovi?, S., & ?e?elj, I. (2022). Intentional non-adherence to official medical recommendations: An irrational choice or negative experience with the healthcare system. https//doi.org/10.31234/osf.io/3yutm
existing_ref: n. a.

label: ?propustio/la sam da odem na preventivni pregled ili kontrolu kod lekara (npr. zubara ili ginekologa).
english: ?skipped a preventive or a regular medical check-up (e.g., to dentist or gynecologist)
contact: Danka Puri?, dpuric@f.bg.ac.rs; Ljiljana Lazarevic, ljiljana.lazarevic@f.bg.ac.rs
citation: Puri?, D., Petrovi?, M. B., ?ivanovic, M., Luki?, P., Zupan, Z., Brankovi?, M., Ninkovi?, M., Lazarevi?, L. B., Stankovi?, S., & ?e?elj, I. (2022). Intentional non-adherence to official medical recommendations: An irrational choice or negative experience with the healthcare system. https//doi.org/10.31234/osf.io/3yutm
existing_ref: n. a.
development: Initial items were developed from a focus group with doctors and a literature search, afterwards they were shortened with a factor analysis.
item_use: This item is used with item "Tokom dana?njeg dana?"
item_instructions: We are now interested in whether any of the following things regarding official medicine have happened to you today.   (Serbian original: Sada nas zanima da li su Vam se neke od navedenih stvari u vezi sa zvani?nom medicinom desile tokom dana?njeg dana.)

label: ?osetio/la sam simptome zbog kojih ljudi obi?no idu kod lekara, ali sam sa?kao/la da simptomi pro?u sami od sebe.
english: ?felt symptoms for which people usually go to the doctor, but waited for these symptoms to pass.
contact: Danka Puri?, dpuric@f.bg.ac.rs; Ljiljana Lazarevic, ljiljana.lazarevic@f.bg.ac.rs
citation: Puri?, D., Petrovi?, M. B., ?ivanovic, M., Luki?, P., Zupan, Z., Brankovi?, M., Ninkovi?, M., Lazarevi?, L. B., Stankovi?, S., & ?e?elj, I. (2022). label: imao/la sam tretman ili pratio/la preporuke prakti?ara alternativne medicine (npr. akupunkture, aromaterapije, homeopatije, kvantne medicine, refleksologije, masa?e poput ?iacua, limfne drena?e, i sl.)

existing_adapt: Items were developed to reflect previous findings from prior studies (Williams et al., 2021a; Williams et al., 2021b). These were developed with consideration given to standardised scales; Adapted Internalised Homophobia scale (Herek, Gillis, & Cogan, 200

item_other: Reverse score items 1-3 for negative perception of LGBTQ+ identity (internalised hatred)

comment: Item is part of a Scale (MPASS), more information on https://osf.io/vstrn &   https://doi.org/10.1111/cdev.13942
branched_from: Wie heb je voor het laatst gezien n gesproken in het afgelopen uur?
branched_response: Answer not "Ik heb mijn (stief)ouders niet gezien en gesproken."
contact: Anne B?low (bulow@essb.eur.nl, PhD Student) & Loes Keijsers (keijsers@essb.eur.nl, PI)
citation: van der Kaap-Deeder,J., B?low, A., Waterschoot, J., Truyen, I., & Keijsers, L. (2023). A moment of autonomy support brightens adolescents' mood: Autonomy support, psychological control and adolescent affect in everyday life. Child Development, 00, 1?13. h
existing_adapt: Items were adapted from a prior daily diary study (Van der Kaap-Deeder et al.,?2017), such that these would be more appropriate for ESM use (e.g., ?My parent took into account how I thought about things.?)
existing_ref: Van der Kaap-Deeder et al.,?2017
item_use: The item has been used with 3 other items to measure parental autnomy support (van der Kaap-Deeder, B?low et al, 2023)
item_instructions: Denk aan dat laatste moment met je ouder wanneer je de volgende vragen gaat beantwoorden. (Think about that last moment with your parent when you answer the following questions.)

existing_ref: Ebesutani, C., Regan, J., Smith, A., Reise, S., Higa-Mcmillan, C., & Chorpita, B. F. (2012). The 10-item positive and negative affect schedule for children, child and parent shortened versions: application of item response theory for more efficient assess

label: Je me suis senti épuisé lorsque je me suis occupé de mes enfants.
english: I felt exhausted while caring for my children.
comment: Items were first developed in French then back-translated toward English; the English items also went through piloting, parent & expert feedback.
response_scale_vas: 1-100 slider (not at all - always) or in French: Pas du tout - toujours
beeps_per_day: We used once a day; ideal would be 1-2 times a day probably (with work/school schedules)
contact: M. Annelise Blanchard (marie.blanchard@uclouvain.be) or Alexandre Heeren (alexandre.heeren@uclouvain.be)
citation: Blanchard, M. A., Revol, J., Hoebeke, Y., Roskam, I., Mikolajczak, M., & Heeren, A. (2023). On the temporal nature of parental burnout: Development of an experience sampling methodology (ESM) tool to assess parental burnout and its related ever-changing f
how_admin: Phone: a personalized webpage sent to them by an email or text message notification
reliability: High between-person reliability when looking at the 3 parental burnout items (Exhaustion, Distance, Feeling Fed Up) together: R(KR) = 0.96
validity: Face validity assessed as sufficient through feedback from participants/experts; some preliminary content validity (i.e., 3 parental burnout ESM items more strongly correlated with retrospective parental burnout scale than retrospective depression or anxi
development: Brainstorming from related cross-sectional questionnaires & creation of new items; parent feedback; multiple rounds of piloting, discussing, and revising; feedback from parental burnout experts. The full development procedure is detailed in this table (ht
item_use: This item has been used in particular with the other two parental burnout items (Emotional Distance & Feeling Fed Up) but also with the other family context items (e.g., interactions with children & partner & wider context)
item_instructions: "Today…" (Either at the top of the screen if items are on one screen together; or before each item if they're on separate screens. If the items are assessed multiple times a day, "Today" could be replaced by e.g., "Since the last survey")
item_other: Items were adapted to match the number of kids participants indicated at baseline (either "my child" or "my children"). For French version of items, they were additionally adapted to the gender of the participant, the gender of their partner (if applicabl

label: In de afgelopen 3 uur voelde ik een sterk verlangen naar hem/haar
english: In the past 3 hours I found myself yearning for him/her.
response_scale_vas: 0-6 (with anchors 0 =  "not at all and 6 = very much.
dataset: GRIEF IN DAILY LIFE PART 1 + GRIEF IN DAILY LIFE PART 2
citation: Lenferink et al. (2022). Is it acceptable and feasible to measure prolonged grief disorder symptoms in daily life using experience sampling methodology? Comprehensive Psychiatry, 119, 152351. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.comppsych.2022.152351
existing_adapt: This item was adapted from the retrospective PGD measure called "Traumatic Grief Iventory-Self Report plus" (TGI-SR+). We added “in the past three hours” to each ESM item. Original item: I found myself yearning for him/her.
existing_ref: Lenferink et al. (2022). Valid measurement of DSM-5 persistent complex bereavement disorder and DSM-5-TR and ICD-11 prolonged grief disorder: The Traumatic Grief Inventory-Self Report Plus (TGI-SR+). Comprehensive Psychiatry, 112, 152281. https://doi.org/
development: Cognitive interviewing with grief and ESM experts was used to develop the items
item_use: This item is used separately to tap one PGD reaction
item_other: Strong floor effects in general bereaved sample

item_use: Events were coded as external or internal. External events actually took place inthe daily environment in the preceding interval, whereas internal eventsreferred to thoughts or feelings, for example about the self or past or futureevents. To avoid confounding of event and mood measures, internal events were not used in the analysis. Negative events were coded according to context,with categories family, peers (friends, classmates, and acquaintances),school, and other. Family, peer, and school events included events in whichthe participant was directly involved (e.g., “a fight with my sister,” “myfriend hit me,” or “did poorly on the test”), as well as events described asconcerning others (e.g., “my brother had to go to the doctor” or “myteacher was in a bad mood”). The “other” category included events involving other categories of people (e.g., strang?ers), leisure activities, personal health, work, or other cont

label: (mVSWMT)
english: (mVSWMT)
comment: PsyMate™ momentary Visualspatial Working Memory Task (mVSWMT)
contact: Simone Verhagen (simone.verhagen@maastrichtuniversity.nl) or Sara L. Bartels sara.bartels@maastrichtuniversity.nl (S.L. Bartels)
open: yes (Verhagen et al., 2019) - no (Daniëls et al., 2020)
citation: Verhagen, S. J., Daniëls, N. E., Bartels, S. L., Tans, S., Borkelmans, K. W., de Vugt, M. E., & Delespaul, P. A. (2019). Measuring within-day cognitive performance using the experience sampling method: A pilot study in a healthy population. PloS one, 14(12), e0226409 AND Daniëls, N. E. M., Bartels, S. L., Verhagen, S. J. W., Van Knippenberg, R. J. M., De Vugt, M. E., & Delespaul, P. A. (2020). Digital assessment of working memory and processing speed in everyday life: Feasibility, validation, and lessons-learned. Internet Interventions, 19, 100300./
how_long_beep: 10 minutes (Verhagen et al., 2019) ; 15 minutes (Daniëls et al., 2020)
item_use: The outcome measure was correct/incorrect (correct = 1) during recall.
item_instructions: The participants were instructed that they would see nine icons to remember. After the participant pressed the start button, icons were presented in a three-by-three grid for eight seconds (encoding phase; see left part of Fig. 2 a). Next, participants answered two interference questions on a seven-point Likert scale: ‘I think I remembered it all’, and ‘Generally, I feel well at the moment’. During the recall phase (see right part of Fig. 2 a), participants were presented with a three-by-three grid of blanc squares with one icon from the original nine above. An in?struction stated to select the square of the original location of the presented icon. The selected square revealed the icons underneath to provide feedback

label: (mDSST)
english: (mDSST)
comment: PsyMate™ momentary Digital Symbol Substitution Task
contact: Simone Verhagen (simone.verhagen@maastrichtuniversity.nl) or Sara L. Bartels sara.bartels@maastrichtuniversity.nl (S.L. Bartels)
open: yes (Verhagen et al., 2019) - no (Daniëls et al., 2020)
citation: Verhagen, S. J., Daniëls, N. E., Bartels, S. L., Tans, S., Borkelmans, K. W., de Vugt, M. E., & Delespaul, P. A. (2019). Measuring within-day cognitive performance using the experience sampling method: A pilot study in a healthy population. PloS one, 14(12), e0226409 AND Daniëls, N. E. M., Bartels, S. L., Verhagen, S. J. W., Van Knippenberg, R. J. M., De Vugt, M. E., & Delespaul, P. A. (2020). Digital assessment of working memory and processing speed in everyday life: Feasibility, validation, and lessons-learned. Internet Interventions, 19, 100300./
how_long_beep: 10 minutes (Verhagen et al., 2019) ; 15 minutes (Daniëls et al., 2020)
development: The PsyMate™ mDSST was inspired by the paper-pencil version of the Digit Symbol Substitution Task (DSST) of the Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale (WAIS) (Wechsler, D., 2008. Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale–Fourth Edition (WAIS–IV). The Psychological Corporation, San Antonio, TX)
item_use: Information processing speed was measured with a modified momentary version of the Digit Symbol Subtitution Task that yielded two outcome measures: the number of trials within 30 seconds and the percentage of correct trials
item_instructions: At the end of the regular ESM beep questionnaire, an instructionscreen appeared with a start button to be pressed when ready. At thetop of the task screen, the numbers 1 to 9 with a corresponding symbol(similar to the WAIS DSST) were displayed for encoding. In the middleof the screen, different numbers were displayed one-by-one for eachtrial. At the bottom of the screen, participants had to select the symbolthat corresponds to the number presented in the middle of the screen(see Fig. 3).

citation: Verhagen, S. J. W. (2020). The power of individual landscapes: a clinical exploration of personal experience sampling and new horizons. Maastricht University, Maastricht.

label: Wat is de hoofdstad van Canada?  A Toronto;B Ottawa ; C Montreal;D Vancouver

citation: Verhagen, S. J. W. (2020). The power of individual landscapes: a clinical exploration of personal experience sampling and new horizons. Maastricht University, Maastricht.

label: A Toronto; B Ottawa; C Montreal; D Vancouver; Wat is de kans dat A juist is?

citation: Verhagen, S. J. W. (2020). The power of individual landscapes: a clinical exploration of personal experience sampling and new horizons. Maastricht University, Maastricht.

label: Kiest u voor een van deze antwoordopties?

label: Wat is volgens u het juiste antwoord?

existing_ref: Myin-Germeys I, Marcelis M, Krabbendam L, Delespaul P, van Os J. 2005c. Subtle fluctuations in psychotic phenomena as functional states of abnormal dopamine reactivity in individuals at risk. Biol Psychiatry 58(2):105–110.
development: ESM psychosis' = sumscore of psychosis symptoms items. A sumscore was preferred over other approaches (e.g. using the highest symptom score as measure for psychosis) because the ESM psychosis measure had to allow to pick up subtle fluctuations in psychotic symptomatology reactive to small, daily life stressors; a score that ranges from 9 to 63 (as in a sumscore) is more likely to allow this than a score that only ranges from 1 to 7 (as in the highest psychotic symptom score). Furthermore, the use of a sumscore was chosen because of its consistency with previous ESM studies that examined psychotic reactivity to daily life stressors [MyinGermeys et al., 2005a,b].

existing_ref: Myin-Germeys I, Marcelis M, Krabbendam L, Delespaul P, van Os J. 2005c. Subtle fluctuations in psychotic phenomena as functional states of abnormal dopamine reactivity in individuals at risk. Biol Psychiatry 58(2):105–110.
development: ESM psychosis' = sumscore of psychosis symptoms items. A sumscore was preferred over other approaches (e.g. using the highest symptom score as measure for psychosis) because the ESM psychosis measure had to allow to pick up subtle fluctuations in psychotic symptomatology reactive to small, daily life stressors; a score that ranges from 9 to 63 (as in a sumscore) is more likely to allow this than a score that only ranges from 1 to 7 (as in the highest psychotic symptom score). Furthermore, the use of a sumscore was chosen because of its consistency with previous ESM studies that examined psychotic reactivity to daily life stressors [MyinGermeys et al., 2005a,b].

label: Ik zou liever wat (/iets) anders doen
english: I would prefer to do something else
which: Residual depressive symptoms after at least one depressive episode, no current depression
citation: Geschwind, N., Peeters, F., Drukker, M., van Os, J., & Wichers, M. (2011). Mindfulness training increases momentary positive emotions and reward experience in adults vulnerable to depression: a randomized controlled trial. J Consult Clin Psychol, 79(5), 618-628. (doi:10.1037/a0024595)
existing_ref: Myin-Germeys, I., van Os, J., Schwartz, J. E., Stone, A. A., & Delespaul, P. A. (2001). Emotional reactivity to daily life stress in psychosis. Archives of General Psychiatry, 58, 1137–1144. doi:10.1001/ archpsyc.58.12.1137
item_use: Factor analysis supported inclusion of four items for activity appraisal (with factor loadings< .6), namely, “I enjoy this activity,” “This activity requires effort,” “I would prefer to do something else,” and “I am skilled at doing this activity.” Two items (“I feel I’m being active,” and “This is a challenge”) had low factor loadings (.05 and .12, respectively) and were consequently not included in the activity pleasantness score. On the basis of the included ratings, a variable reflecting “pleasantness of current activity” was generated.  Consistent with Wichers et al. (2009), low scores (?4) on all four items were set to zero (so that negative activity appraisals did not contribute to the overall score), and higher scores were recoded (5 = 1, 6 = 2, 7 = 3) before calculating a sum score for activity pleasantness. High pleasantness thus reflected high skill, low effort, low preference for doing something else, and high enjoyment of the activity

label: Ik voel me opgewekt
english: I feel cheerful
existing_adapt: Peeters, F., Berkhof, J., Delespaul, P., Rottenberg, J., & Nicholson, N. A. (2006). Diurnal mood variation in major depressive disorder. Emotion, 6(3), 383-391. doi:10.1037/1528-3542.6.3.383 AND Peeters, F., Nicholson, N. A., & Berkhof, J. (2003). Cortisol responses to daily events in major depressive disorder. Psychosom Med, 65(5), 836-841. /
existing_ref: Barge-Schaapveld, D. Q., & Nicolson, N. A. (2002). Effects of antidepressant treatment on the quality of daily life: an experience sampling study. The Journal of clinical psychiatry, 63(6), 477–485. https://doi.org/10.4088/jcp.v63n0603; Myin-Germeys, I., Peeters, F., Havermans, R., Nicolson, N. A., DeVries, M. W., Delespaul, P., & Van Os, J. (2003). Emotional reactivity to daily life stress in psychosis and affective disorder: an experience sampling study. Acta psychiatrica Scandinavica, 107(2), 124–131. https://doi.org/10.1034/j.1600-0447.2003.02025.x; Myin-Germeys, I., van Os, J., Schwartz, J. E., Stone, A. A., & Delespaul, P. A. (2001). Emotional reactivity to daily life stress in psychosis. Archives of general psychiatry, 58(12), 1137–1144. https://doi.org/10.1001/archpsyc.58.12.1137; van Eck, M., Nicolson, N. A., & Berkhof, J. (1998). Effects of stressful daily events on mood states: relationship to global perceived stress. J Pers Soc Psychol, 75(6), 1572-1585. (doi:10.1037//0022-3514.75.6.1572)
development: We relied on items that were used previously by our research group in different populations
item_use: Ratings on the items energetic, enthusiastic, happy, cheerful, talkative, strong, satisfied, and self-assured were averaged to form a positive affect (PA) scale
item_other: We chose to include items typical of pleasantness-unpleasantness as well as activation or arousal dimensions because these seemed necessary in order to capture clinically relevant aspects of daily emotional experience in major depression. We did not use the PANAS-scales (Watson & Clark, 1988) as they contain “pure” activation items (see for a discussion; Watson et al., 1999)

item_other: We chose to include items typical of pleasantness-unpleasantness as well as activation or arousal dimensions because these seemed necessary in order to capture clinically relevant aspects of daily emotional experience in major depression. label: Welke stressvolle gebeurtenis is er voorgevallen?
english: What stressful event occured?
citation: van Eck, M., Nicolson, N. A., & Berkhof, J. (1998). Effects of stressful daily events on mood states: relationship to global perceived stress. J Pers Soc Psychol, 75(6), 1572-1585. (doi:10.1037//0022-3514.75.6.1572)
item_use: Participants' descriptions of stressful daily events were coded according to the activity context, with the categories work, network (events involving family, friends, and acquaintances), household-financial, leisure, personal health-somatic, personal health-psychological, transport, and other. As recommended by Eckenrode (1984), the 12 events that were coded in one of the personal health categories were excluded from the analysis to avoid possible confounding with the mood outcome measures. The analysis differentiated between work versus other (i.e., nonwork) events only. Event descriptions were also scored according to whether or not they explicitly mentioned a stressful social interaction or a task demand (t.g., overloads, deadlines)
