existing_ref: Kirtley, O., Achterhof, R., Hagemann, N., Hermans, K. S. F. M., Hiekkaranta, A. P., Lecei, A., Boets, B., Henquet, C., Kasanova, Z., Schneider, M., van Winkel, R., Reininghaus, U., Viechtbauer, W., & Myin-Germeys, I. (2021). Initial cohort characteristics and protocol for SIGMA: An accelerated longitudinal study of environmental factors, inter- and intrapersonal processes, and mental health in adolescence. https://doi.org/10.31234/osf.io/jp2fk
development: Partly inspired by the cognitive-emotional model of NSSI [Hasking P, Whitlock J, Voon D, Rose A. A cognitive-emotional model of NSSI: using emotion regulation and cognitiveprocesses to explain why people self-injure. Cogn Emot 2017 Dec;31(8):1543-1556 [doi: 10.1080/02699931.2016.1241219], we anticipate that momentary self-efficacy to resist NSSI will be a potent protective factor against NSSI behavior. People retrospectively report that the transition between NSSI thoughts or urges and NSSI behavior is typically <30 minutes, meaning that there might be a brief window of opportunity to intervene during these moments of acute risk for NSSI behavior. Therefore, in an attempt to inform and facilitate such intervention efforts, we will make a thought-to-action distinction and clarify the specificity of risk and protective factors to identify factors thatincrease or decrease the likelihood of transitioning from NSSI thoughts or urges to NSSI behavior in real time among individuals seeking treatment

label: Sinds de laatste beep, heb je jezelf opzettelijk verwond zonder de wens om je leven te beëindigen (bijvoorbeeld jezelf gesneden, gekrabd, of geslagen)?
english: Since the last beep, have you deliberately hurt yourself without wanting to die (for example, cut, scratched, or hit yourself)?

item_instructions: Although NSSI behavior was assessed retrospectively during each EMA survey (ie, "Since the last beep, have you deliberately hurt yourself without wanting to die?"), participants were instructed to register the timing of NSSI behavior through an event marker. This occurred on a wearable wireless device (Chill Band +; IMEC International) for the first 12 participants. However, owing to practical and technical issues with these devices, the remaining participants used an event registration push button in the m-Path app.

label: Gelieve alle gedragingen aan te duiden waar je sinds de laatste beep aan dacht of hebt gesteld, of waarvoor er momenteel een drang aanwezig is:
english: Indicate all other behaviors you thought about or engaged in since the last beep, or for which you have an urge right now
response_scale_discrete: (a) Restrictive eating/diëten, (b) binge eating/(vr)eetbui, (c) vomiting deliberately/opzettelijk braken, (d) killing myself/zelfdoding, (e) binge drinking/bingedrinken, (f) using cannabis/cannabis smoren, (g) none of these/geen van bovenstaande (categorical)
citation: Kiekens G, Claes L, Schoefs S, Kemme NDF, Luyckx K, Kleiman EM, Nock MK, Myin-Germeys I, The Detection of Acute Risk of Self-injury Project: Protocol for an Ecological Momentary Assessment Study Among Individuals Seeking Treatment, JMIR Res Protoc 2023;12:e46244. URL: https://www.researchprotocols.org/2023/1/e46244, doi: 10.2196/46244
development: Disordered eating (ie, restrictive eating, binge eating, and purging), substance use (ie, binge drinking and smoking cannabis), and STB were assessed as secondary outcomes. From a transdiagnostic approach, this will help to clarify comorbidity patterns, unique versus shared risk factors, and temporal relationships with other self-damaging behaviors in daily life.

label: Sinds de laatste beep, dacht je eraan om jezelf te doden?
english: Since the last beep, have you thought about killing yourself?
branched_from: Indicate all other behaviors you thought about or engaged in since the last beep, or for which you have an urge right now
citation: Kiekens G, Claes L, Schoefs S, Kemme NDF, Luyckx K, Kleiman EM, Nock MK, Myin-Germeys I, The Detection of Acute Risk of Self-injury Project: Protocol for an Ecological Momentary Assessment Study Among Individuals Seeking Treatment, JMIR Res Protoc 2023;12:e46244. development: Disordered eating (ie, restrictive eating, binge eating, and purging), substance use (ie, binge drinking and smoking cannabis), and STB were assessed as secondary outcomes. From a transdiagnostic approach, this will help to clarify comorbidity patterns, unique versus shared risk factors, and temporal relationships with other self-damaging behaviors in daily life.
item_use: A safety protocol is activated whenever a participant reports having attempted suicide or is at imminent risk for attempting suicide, operationalized as having an intense urge to attempt suicide (response 6 or 7 on a 7-point scale) combined with momentary low self-efficacy to resist this suicidal urge (responses 1-3 on a 7-point scale). A second automatic pop-up screen is triggered whenever this response pattern occurs, encouraging participants to provide more in-the-moment information within an open text field. After submitting this item (even when left blank), this response pattern issues an alert to the research team (ie, flagged email to the study account that is consistently monitored during recruitment hours).

label: [[first_name]], what is your mood right now on a scale of 1 to 9 (9 being best)?  Please respond with a number and a message about what you are doing or thinking.
other: Once a day at random times between 9 Am and 8 PM
citation: Aguilera, A., Schueller, S. M. & Leykin, Y. (2015). Daily mood ratings via text message as a proxy for clinic based depression assessment. Journal of affective disorders, 175, 471-474. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jad.2015.01.033.

label: T01|[[first_name ]], think about your day. Can you think of a thought that helped you today?
citation: Aguilera, A., Schueller, S. M. & Leykin, Y. (2015). Daily mood ratings via text message as a proxy for clinic based depression assessment. Journal of affective disorders, 175, 471-474. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jad.2015.01.033.
item_use: The module sequence was sent once a day while patients were attending therapy. The module sequence is composed by adding in one item from each of the 4 different categories: Thoughts (T), Activities (A), People (P), and Health (H). Each category has 28 messages. The message content can be in the form of a question or statement. These messages are an adjunct to the topics discussed in therapy. There was no response expected for the module messages.

label: T02|You are in control of your thoughts and how you view the world.
citation: Aguilera, A., Schueller, S. M. & Leykin, Y. (2015). Daily mood ratings via text message as a proxy for clinic based depression assessment. Journal of affective disorders, 175, 471-474. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jad.2015.01.033.

label: Haben Sie sich seit dem letzten Abruf Gedanken über irgendeine soziale Interaktion gemacht?
english: Did you ruminate about any social interaction since the last beep?
response_scale_discrete: 7-point Likert scale (1=not at all ("gar nicht"), 7=almost all the time ("fast die ganze Zeit") (discrete)
which: Low or high scores on the Social Phobia Inventory (SPIN)
citation: Badra, M., Schulze, L., Becker, E. S., Vrijsen, J.N., Renneberg, B. & Zetsche, U. (2017). The association between ruminative thinking and negative interpretation bias in social anxiety. Cognition & emotion, 31(6), 1234-1242. https://doi.org/10.1080/02699931.2016.1193477
how_admin: Smartphone application on study phones or own phones
item_use: This item is used as a stand alone item (not part of a scale)
item_other: Please note that the German wording ("Gedanken machen über") has a negative connotation and is typically used for recurrent thoughts about something negative.. Remarks about the population: This was neither a clicinal sample nor general population. It was a student sample screened for low and high scores on a questionnaire assessing social anxiety disorder symptoms. We did not assess any categorical diagnoses.

label: Ich empfand mein Verhalten in sozialen Interaktionen seit dem letzten Abruf als €¦
english: I felt my behavior in social interactions since the last alarm was ...
response_scale_discrete: 7-point Likert scale (1=very negative ("sehr negativ"), 7=very positive ("sehr positiv") (discrete)
which: Low or high scores on the Social Phobia Inventory (SPIN)
citation: Badra, M., Schulze, L., Becker, E. S., Vrijsen, J.N., Renneberg, B. & Zetsche, U. (2017). The association between ruminative thinking and negative interpretation bias in social anxiety. Cognition & emotion, 31(6), 1234-1242. https://doi.org/10.1080/02699931.2016.1193477
existing_ref: has not been published
item_use: This item is used as a stand alone item (not part of a scale)
item_other: Remarks about the population: This was neither a clicinal sample nor general population. It was a student sample screened for low and high scores on a questionnaire assessing social anxiety disorder symptoms. We did not assess any categorical diagnoses.

label: Wie traurig fühlen Sie sich gerade?
english: How sad are you feeling right now?
response_scale_discrete: 7-point Likert scale (1=not at all ("gar nicht"), 7=very much ("sehr") (discrete)
citation: Badra, M., Schulze, L., Becker, E. S., Vrijsen, J.N., Renneberg, B. & Zetsche, U. (2017). The association between ruminative thinking and negative interpretation bias in social anxiety. Cognition & emotion, 31(6), 1234-1242. https://doi.org/10.1080/02699931.2016.1193477
existing_ref: Zetsche, U., Bürkner, P. C., & Renneberg, B. (2019). Future expectations in clinical depression: Biased or realistic?. Journal of Abnormal Psychology, 128(7), 678.
development: Item based on PANAS-X German version (Watson, D., & Clark, L. A. (1999). The PANAS-X: Manual for the positive and negative affect schedule-expanded form.)
item_use: This item was part of a negative mood scale
item_other: Remarks about the population: The study comprised two samples. 1. a student sample screened for low and high scores on a questionnaire assessing social anxiety disorder symptoms. We did not assess any categorical diagnoses in this sample. 2. a sample of currently depressed individuals and a healthy control group (as established by SCID interview)

label: Wie niedergeschlagen fühlen Sie sich gerade?
english: How downhearted are you feeling right now?
response_scale_discrete: 7-point Likert scale (1=not at all ("gar nicht"), 7=very much ("sehr") (discrete)
citation: Badra, M., Schulze, L., Becker, E. S., Vrijsen, J.N., Renneberg, B. & Zetsche, U. (2017). The association between ruminative thinking and negative interpretation bias in social anxiety. Cognition & emotion, 31(6), 1234-1242. https://doi.org/10.1080/02699931.2016.1193477
existing_ref: Zetsche, U., Bürkner, P. C., & Renneberg, B. (2019). Future expectations in clinical depression: Biased or realistic?. Journal of Abnormal Psychology, 128(7), 678.

item_use: This item was part of a negative mood scale
item_other: Remarks about the population: The study comprised two samples. 1. a student sample screened for low and high scores on a questionnaire assessing social anxiety disorder symptoms. label: Warum haben Sie letzte Nacht nicht gut geschlafen?
english: Why did you not sleep well last night?

label: Since the last assessment, how much have you been bothered by repeated, disturbing memories, thoughts, or images of the event?
response_scale_discrete: 5-point scale from 1 (Not at all), 2 (A little bit), 3 (Moderately), 4 (Quite a bit), 5 (A lot) (discrete)
beeps_per_day: 3 (random with intervals in the morning, afternoon and evening)
citation: Hruska, B., Pacella, M. L., George, R. L. & Delahanty, D. L. (2016). Trajectories of daily PTSD symptoms in recent traumatic injury victims. Psychological trauma : theory, research, practice and policy, 8(6), 676-679. https://doi.org/10.1037/tra0000145
reliability: In the current study, Cronbach€™s alphas for SF-PCL items ranged from .83 to .90 on Day 1 and .88 to .91 on Day 7
validity: The SF-PCL has been shown to have a concurrent validity score of .96 (in medical and community settings) (Hirschel, M. J., & Schulenberg, S. E. (2010). On the viability of PTSD Checklist (PCL) short form use: Analyses from Mississippi Gulf Coast Hurricane Katrina survivors. Psychological Assessment, 22, 460 - 464. http://dx.doi.org/10.1037/a0018336)
development: Item derived from SF-PCL (Lang, A. J., & Stein, M. B. (2005). An abbreviated PTSD Checklist for use as a screening instrument in primary care. Behaviour Research and Therapy, 43, 585-594. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.brat.2004.04.005)
item_instructions: At each signal participants were asked to "complete the following questions with reference to the event that recently caused you to be hospitalized." They were then asked to rate how much they had been bothered by each symptom since the last daily assessment

response_scale_discrete: 5-point scale from 1 (Not at all), 2 (A little bit), 3 (Moderately), 4 (Quite a bit), 5 (A lot) (discrete)
beeps_per_day: 3 (random with intervals in the morning, afternoon and evening)
citation: Hruska, B., Pacella, M. L., George, R. L. & Delahanty, D. L. (2016). Trajectories of daily PTSD symptoms in recent traumatic injury victims. Psychological trauma : theory, research, practice and policy, 8(6), 676-679. https://doi.org/10.1037/tra0000145
reliability: In the current study, Cronbach€™s alphas for SF-PCL items ranged from .83 to .90 on Day 1 and .88 to .91 on Day 7
validity: The SF-PCL has been shown to have a concurrent validity score of .96 (in medical and community settings) (Hirschel, M. J., & Schulenberg, S. E. (2010). On the viability of PTSD Checklist (PCL) short form use: Analyses from Mississippi Gulf Coast Hurricane Katrina survivors. Psychological Assessment, 22, 460 - 464. http://dx.doi.org/10.1037/a0018336)
development: Item derived from SF-PCL (Lang, A. J., & Stein, M. B. (2005). An abbreviated PTSD Checklist for use as a screening instrument in primary care. Behaviour Research and Therapy, 43, 585-594. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.brat.2004.04.005)
item_instructions: At each signal participants were asked to "complete the following questions with reference to the event that recently caused you to be hospitalized." They were then asked to rate how much they had been bothered by each symptom since the last daily assessment

english: What was the average level of social anxiety you have experience during the last 24 hours
other: daily diary at the end of each day or within 1 hour of waking up next morning
which: Individuals with high and low levels of social anxiety disorder
citation: Kivity, Y., & Huppert, J. D. (2016). Does cognitive reappraisal reduce anxiety? A daily diary study of a micro-intervention with individuals with high social anxiety. Journal of consulting and clinical psychology, 84(3), 269-283. https://doi.org/10.1037/ccp0000075
how_admin: daily text message reminders each evening with a link to the online daily diary
how_long_beep: complete the daily diary at the end of each day or within 1 hour of waking up next morning
development: We reviewed previous ESM studies of social anxiety and emotion regulation (e.g., studies by Todd Kashsan)
item_other: Remarks about the population: Hebrew-speaking participants

label: Erleben Sie gerade eine der folgenden Emotionen?
english: Do you feel any of the following emotions right now?
comment: original answer categories: Freude; Angst; Ärger; Scham; Ekel; Trauer; Schuld; Interesse; Neid/Eifersucht; Emotion, aber nicht benennbar; keine Emotion
response_scale_discrete: joy; anxiety; anger; shame; disgust; sadness; guilt; interest; envy/jealousy; emotion but cannot name it; no emotion (categorical)
beeps_per_day: Every 15 min (±1 min) during their waking time; participants provided, on average, 57.6 self-reports on one assessment day
which: borderline personality disorder (BPD), PTSD, bulimia nervosa
contact: Tobias D. Kockler (tobias.kockler@kit.edu), Ulrich W. Ebner-Priemer (ulrich.ebner-priemer@kit.edu), Philip S. Santangelo (philip.santangelo@uni.lu)
citation: Kockler, T.D., Tschacher, W., Santangelo, P.S. et al. Specificity of emotion sequences in borderline personality disorder compared to posttraumatic stress disorder, bulimia nervosa, and healthy controls: an e-diary study. bord personal disord emot dysregul 4, 26 (2017). https://doi.org/10.1186/s40479-017-0077-1
how_admin: palmtop computers (Tungsten E, Palm Inc., U.S.A.): DialogPad e-diary-software (Gerhard Mutz, Cologne University, Germany)
development: same set of items as Reisch T, Ebner-Priemer UW, Tschacher W, Bohus M, Linehan MM. Sequences of emotions in patients with borderline personality disorder. Acta Psychiatr Scand. 2008;118:42-8. doi: 10.1111/j.1600-0447.2008.01222.x
item_other: Remarks about the population: only females recruited

label: Az éjjel mélyen aludtam.
english: I had a deep sleep last night
comment: first item not included in scoring
citation: Simor, P., Krietsch, K. N., Köteles, F., & McCrae, C. S. (2015). Day-to-day variation of subjective sleep quality and emotional states among healthy university students—A 1-week prospective study. International journal of behavioral medicine, 22, 625-634.
existing_adapt: The response scale for this item was adapted from the original 1 - 5 scale.
existing_ref: Simor P, Köteles F, Bódizs R. Bárdos G [A questionnaire based study of subjective sleep quality: the psychometric evaluation of the Hungarian version of the Groningen Sleep Quality Scale]. Mentálhigiéné es Pszichoszomatika. 2009;10:249-61
reliability: Cronbach's alpha values for sleep quality varied between 0.72 and 0.87 during the study period (from day 1 to day 7).
item_use: first item not included in scoring

label: Úgy érzem, rosszul aludtam az éjjel.
english: I feel like I slept poorly last night

response_scale_discrete: 5-point Likert scale, 1- very slightly, or not at all; 2- a little; 3- moderately; 4- quite a bit, 5-very much (HUN: 1- Egyáltalán nem, vagy csak alig, 2- Kicsit, 3-Mérsékelten, 4- Eléggé, 5- Nagyonvagy alig) (discrete)

reliability: Cronbach's alpha values for positive  affect scores varied between 0.74-0.81
development: item derived from PANAS (Watson D, Clark LA, Tellegen A. Development and validation of brief measures of positive and negative affect: the PANAS scales. J Pers Soc Psychol. 1988;54:1063-70.).

label: Over the course of the day today, how depressed did you feel?
english: Over the course of the day today, how depressed did you feel?
response_scale_discrete: 10-point Likert scale (not at all to extremely) (discrete)
request: no (beyond consent, but happy to collaborate/provide further results) (lisa.starr@rochester.edu)
citation: Starr, L. R. (2015). When Support Seeking Backfires: Co-Rumination, Excessive Reassurance Seeking, and Depressed Mood in the Daily Lives of Young Adults. Journal of social and clinical psychology, 34(5), 436-457. https://doi.org/10.1521/jscp.2015.34.5.436
how_long_beep: Auto-emailed reminders end-of-day at participant selected time. As bedtimes may have varied by night, data cleaning was based on sample-designated cut-off for early morning, not on individualized timing.
validity: Supporting this item's convergent validity, both baseline major depression diagnosis and the DASS-21 depression subscale robustly predicted depressed mood (both ps < .000001). Supporting discriminant validity, depressed mood was predicted by MDE diagnosis, but not by social phobia, panic disorder, generalized anxiety disorder, or obsessive-compulsive disorder (controlling for variance shared between disorders). Likewise, when depression, anxiety, and stress subscales from the DASS-21 were entered simultaneously into a model predicting daily depressed mood, only the depression subscale emerged as significant.
development: Face-valid

how_long_beep: Auto-emailed reminders end-of-day at participant selected time. As bedtimes may have varied by night, data cleaning was based on sample-designated cut-off for early morning, not on individualized timing.
development: Conway, Slavich, and Hammen (2014) developed this inventory explicitly for diary applications within undergraduate populations, using items from previously existing measures (Seidlitz, L., & Diener, E. (1993). Memory for positive versus negative life events:Theories for the differences between happy and unhappy persons. Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 64, 654-664.; Shahar, G., Henrich, C. C., Reiner, I. C., & Little, T. D. (2003). Development and initial validation of the brief adolescent life event scale (BALES). Anxiety, Stress & Coping, 16, 119-128).
item_use: To ensure that overlapping events were not double counted, daily occurrence of hassles was coded dichotomously (0 = no hassles, 1 = one or more hassles reported).
item_instructions: Please read through the list of stressful events and indicate by checking the yes box if any of the events has occurred today.  If yes, indicate the number of times that event occurred today.

development: Conway, Slavich, and Hammen (2014) developed this inventory explicitly for diary applications within undergraduate populations, using items from previously existing measures (Seidlitz, L., & Diener, E. Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 64, 654-664.; Shahar, G., Henrich, C. C., Reiner, I. C., & Little, T. D. (2003). Development and initial validation of the brief adolescent life event scale (BALES). Anxiety, Stress & Coping, 16, 119-128).
item_instructions: Please read through the list of stressful events and indicate by checking the yes box if any of the events has occurred today.  If yes, indicate the number of times that event occurred today.

label: How anxious did you feel, on average, over the course of the day today?
english: How anxious did you feel, on average, over the course of the day today?
which: generalised anxiety disorder, at least symptoms of major depressive disorder
request: no (outstide consent, but will run analyses on your behalf) (lisa.starr@rochester.edu)
citation: Starr, L. R., & Davila, J. (2012). Temporal patterns of anxious and depressed mood in generalized anxiety disorder: A daily diary study. Behaviour research and therapy, 50(2), 131-141.- AND Starr, L. R., & Davila, J. (2012). Cognitive and interpersonal moderators of daily co-occurrence of anxious and depressed moods in generalized anxiety disorder. Cognitive Therapy and Research, 36, 655-669.
how_admin: Online (emailed reminder with link to http://www.psychdata.com) or paper-pencil
how_long_beep: Not yolked to prompt. Data were cleaned to ensure that responses occurred within evening or late night hours, before a designated cut-off time
validity: Supporting convergent and divergent validity, daily anxious mood was predicted by baseline BAI (b = .08, SE = .02, P < .001) but not baseline BDI (b = .03, SE = .02, P = .26)
development: Because excessive diary length substantially reduces compliance (Morren, M., Dulmen, S., Ouwerkerk, J., & Bensing, J. (2009). Compliance with momentary pain measurement using electronic diaries: A systematic review. European Journal of Pain, 13(4), 354-365.), and because no measures of relevant constructs have been specifically validated as diary assessments (to our knowledge), all diary items were face valid and designed to quickly and efficiently assess constructs of interest.

Cognitive and interpersonal moderators of daily co-occurrence of anxious and depressed moods in generalized anxiety disorder. Cognitive Therapy and Research, 36, 655-669.
how_admin: Online (emailed reminder with link to http://www.psychdata.com) or paper-pencil
how_long_beep: Not yolked to prompt. Data were cleaned to ensure that responses occurred within evening or late night hours, before a designated cut-off time
development: Because excessive diary length substantially reduces compliance (Morren, M., Dulmen, S., Ouwerkerk, J., & Bensing, J. (2009). Compliance with momentary pain measurement using electronic diaries: A systematic review. European Journal of Pain, 13(4), 354-365.), and because no measures of relevant constructs have been specifically validated as diary assessments (to our knowledge), all diary items were face valid and designed to quickly and efficiently assess constructs of interest.

other: notification times were personalized to three convenient times per day with five hours interval (e.g., 12:00, 17:00, 22:00).

label: Afgelopen dagdeel werd ik overspoeld door wat er mis ging of door mijn tekortkomingen:
english: Last part of the day I was obsessed and fixated by my own flaws and inadequacies:
response_scale_vas: VAS scale: 0=Helemaal niet/not at all       50=Tamelijk/quite       100=Heel erg/very much
other: notification times were personalized to three convenient times per day with five hours interval (e.g., 12:00, 17:00, 22:00).
citation: Houtveen, J. H., van Eck van der Sluijs, J., Thorsell, S., van Broeckhuysen-Kloth, S., & Geenen, R. (2022). Changed dynamic symptom networks after a self-compassion training in patients with somatic symptom disorder: A multiple single-case pilot project. Journal of psychosomatic research, 154, 110724. doi: 10.1016/j.jpsychores.2022.110724
development: item derived from Self-Compassion Scale (SCS -K.D. Neff, The development and validation of a scale to measure self-compassion, self, Identity. 2 (2003) 223-250, https://doi.org/10.1080/15298860309027.) Instead of measuring self-compassion using all 24 items of the original Self Compassion Scale (SCS) questionnaire, with help of the two group therapists who provided the self-compassion training, we selected a prototypical item for each of the six components of the SCS and modified them to refer to the previous part of the day. We reduced the number of items to limit the burden for and dropout of participants.
item_use: Self-compassion was assessed by six items derived from the Self-Compassion Scale (SCS) [27] (selfkindness, self-judgement, common humanity, isolation, mindfulness, and over-identification) which were (after recoding negative items) averaged to obtain one self-compassion score.

label: Afgelopen dagdeel was ik: [één gepersonaliseerde negatief affect-emotie, namelijk: bedroefd, teneergeslagen, schuldig, angstig, vijandig, prikkelbaar (vlug geürriteerd), beschaamd, gespannen, zenuwachtig OF bang]
english: Last part of the day I felt: [one personalized negative affect emotion; upset, distressed, guilty, hostile, irritable, anxious,  ashamed, jittery, nervous OR scared)
response_scale_vas: VAS scale: 0=Helemaal niet/not at all       50=Tamelijk/quite       100=Heel erg/very much
other: notification times were personalized to three convenient times per day with five hours interval (e.g., 12:00, 17:00, 22:00).

development: item based on PANAS (Watson, D., Clark, L. A., & Tellegen, A. (1988). Development and validation of brief measures of positive and negative affect: the PANAS scales. Journal of personality and social psychology, 54(6), 1063.)
item_other: Patients had to complete a short baseline questionnaire with only 5 items once at the start of the ESM-study. In this questionnaire, patients could select a positive and negative affect item, (optionally) a personalized somatic symptom, and the preferred time in the (end of the morning) for the first notification.

label: Afgelopen 3 uur was de ernst van mijn lichamelijke klachten
english: Over the past 3 hours, the severity of my physical symptoms has been
response_scale_vas: 0-100 (0=no severe physical symptoms/(Dutch"geen ernstige lichamelijke klachten", 100=worst severity possible/(Dutch:"ergste ernst mogelijk")
which: chronic condition suffering from persistent fatigue
citation: Vroegindeweij, A., Swart, J. F., Houtveen, J., Eijkelkamp, N., Van De Putte, E. M., Wulffraat, N. M., & Nijhof, S. L. (2022). item_other: Remarks about the population: Respondents were adolescents and young adults (aged 12-29)

label: עד כמה היו המשפטים הבאים נכונים עבורך מאז הפעם האחרונה שמילאת את השאלון? - ניסיתי להבין את המחשבות, הרצונות והרגשות של אנשים סביבי שהובילו אותם להתנהגות מסוימת
english: Since the last time I completed the questionnaire, I tried to understand the thoughts, desires, and feelings that led people around me to their behavior
citation: Steinberg, N., Moshe-Cohen, R., Sheena, L. et al. Capturing a mentalized moment: A pilot study of the psychometric properties of a novel assessment method of mentalizing in daily life. Curr Psychol (2023). https://doi.org/10.1007/s12144-023-04963-w
development: adapted for momentary assessment from the following items of the Mentalization Scale: I find it important to understand reasons for my behavior; To understand someone's behavior, we need to know her/his thoughts, wishes, andfeelings
item_other: Remarks about the population: BPD in a non-clinical sample of undergraduate students

label: עד כמה היו המשפטים הבאים נכונים עבורך מאז הפעם האחרונה שמילאת את השאלון? - ניסיתי להבין את המחשבות, הרצונות והרגשות שהובילו אותי להתנהגות מסוימת
english: Since the last time I completed the questionnaire, I tried to understand the thoughts, desires, and feelings that led to my behavior
citation: Steinberg, N., Moshe-Cohen, R., Sheena, L. et al. Capturing a mentalized moment: A pilot study of the psychometric properties of a novel assessment method of mentalizing in daily life. Curr Psychol (2023). https://doi.org/10.1007/s12144-023-04963-w
development: adapted for momentary assessment from the following items of the Mentalization Scale: I find it important to understand reasons for my behavior; To understand someone's behavior, we need to know her/his thoughts, wishes, andfeelings
item_other: Remarks about the population: BPD in a non-clinical sample of undergraduate students

label: באמצעות הקלטה קולית, נבקש כי תתאר/י את הרגע שעורר בך הכי הרבה רגש (נעים או לא נעים) מאז הפעם האחרונה שמילאת את השאלון.
english: Please use an audio-recording to describe the most emotionally intense moment (pleasant or unpleasant) since the last time you completed the questionnaire
citation: Steinberg, N., Moshe-Cohen, R., Sheena, L. et al. Capturing a mentalized moment: A pilot study of the psychometric properties of a novel assessment method of mentalizing in daily life. Curr Psychol (2023). https://doi.org/10.1007/s12144-023-04963-w
item_use: All audio recordings were transcribed and scored with the Reflective Functioning Scale (11 point scale)
item_other: Remarks about the population: BPD in a non-clinical sample of undergraduate students

label: Haben Sie sich seit dem letzten Abruf Gedanken über irgendeine soziale Interaktion gemacht?
english: Did you ruminate about any social interaction since the last beep?
response_scale_discrete: 7-point Likert scale (1=not at all ("gar nicht"), 7=almost all the time ("fast die ganze Zeit") (discrete)
which: Low or high scores on the Social Phobia Inventory (SPIN)
citation: Badra, M., Schulze, L., Becker, E. S., Vrijsen, J.N., Renneberg, B. & Zetsche, U. (2017). The association between ruminative thinking and negative interpretation bias in social anxiety. Cognition & emotion, 31(6), 1234-1242. https://doi.org/10.1080/02699931.2016.1193477.
how_admin: Smartphone application on study phones or own phones
item_use: This item is used as a stand alone item (not part of a scale)
item_other: Please note that the German wording (Gedanken machen über) has a negative connotation and is typically used for recurrent thoughts about something negative.. Remarks about the population: This was neither a clicinal sample nor general population. It was a student sample screened for low and high scores on a questionnaire assessing social anxiety disorder symptoms. We did not assess any categorical diagnoses.

label: Ich empfand mein Verhalten in sozialen Interaktionen seit dem letzten Abruf als …
english: I felt my behavior in social interactions since the last alarm was ...
response_scale_discrete: 7-point Likert scale (1=very negative ("sehr negativ"), 7=very positive ("sehr positiv") (discrete)
which: Low or high scores on the Social Phobia Inventory (SPIN)
citation: has not been published
item_use: This item is used as a stand alone item (not part of a scale)
item_other: Remarks about the population: This was neither a clicinal sample nor general population. It was a student sample screened for low and high scores on a questionnaire assessing social anxiety disorder symptoms. We did not assess any categorical diagnoses.

label: Wie traurig fühlen Sie sich gerade?
english: How sad are you feeling right now?
response_scale_discrete: 7-point Likert scale (1=not at all ("gar nicht"), 7=very much ("sehr") (discrete)
citation: Zetsche, U., Bürkner, P. C., & Renneberg, B. (2019). Future expectations in clinical depression: Biased or realistic?. Journal of Abnormal Psychology, 128(7), 678.
existing_ref: Watson, D., & Clark, L. A. (1999). The PANAS-X: Manual for the positive and negative affect schedule-expanded form.
development: PANAS-X German Version
item_use: This item was part of a negative mood scale
item_other: Remarks about the population: The study comprised two samples. 1. a student sample screened for low and high scores on a questionnaire assessing social anxiety disorder symptoms. We did not assess any categorical diagnoses in this sample. 2. a sample of currently depressed individuals and a healthy control group (as established by SCID interview)

label: Wie niedergeschlagen fühlen Sie sich gerade?
english: How depressed are you feeling right now?
response_scale_discrete: 7-point Likert scale (1=not at all ("gar nicht"), 7=very much ("sehr") (discrete)
citation: Zetsche, U., Bürkner, P. C., & Renneberg, B. (2019). Future expectations in clinical depression: Biased or realistic?. Journal of Abnormal Psychology, 128(7), 678. ANDZetsche, U., Bürkner, P. C., Bohländer, J., Renneberg, B., Roepke, S., & Schulze, L. (2024). Daily Emotion Regulation in Major Depression and Borderline Personality Disorder. Clinical Psychological Science, 12(1), 161-170AND Zetsche, U., Neumann, P., Bürkner, P. C., Renneberg, B., Koster, E. H., & Hoorelbeke, K. (2024). Computerized cognitive control training to reduce rumination in major depression: A randomized controlled trial. Behaviour Research and Therapy, 104521.
existing_ref: Watson, D., & Clark, L. A. (1999). The PANAS-X: Manual for the positive and negative affect schedule-expanded form.
development: PANAS-X German Version
item_use: This item was part of a negative mood scale
item_other: Note that this item was also used in the Emotion regulation MDD and BPD AND Cognitive Control Training datasets. Remarks about the population: The study comprised two samples. 1. a student sample screened for low and high scores on a questionnaire assessing social anxiety disorder symptoms. We did not assess any categorical diagnoses in this sample. 2. a sample of currently depressed individuals and a healthy control group (as established by SCID interview)
